title: Drawing, "Design for Armchair and Stool", 1790
medium: Brush and watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on white laid paper. Ruled borders in pen and black ink.
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
dimensions:
Sheet: 21.5 x 34.3 cm (8 7/16 x 13 1/2 in.)
matted with -134B
Mat:  55.9 x 40.6 cm (22 x 16 in.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description:
Left: Egyptian style curule stool, x-shaped legs terminating in bird heads. Seat is fringed in gold color.
Right: Armchair, round back pierced in a gothic design, legs slightly splayed, upholstered blue seat.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Armchair and Stool", 1790.
1790. Brush and watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on white laid paper. Ruled borders in pen and black ink.. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-135.
